items.title: Watch the +SF Super Bowl Committee's Press Conference, live from San Francisco's Ferry Building. +Mayor...

object.content: Watch the +SF Super Bowl Committee's Press Conference, live from San Francisco's Ferry Building. +Mayor Ed Lee of San Francisco and Bid Committee Chair Daniel Lurie will be joined by other Bid Committee Members to outline their formal bid for San Francisco to host Super Bowl L in 2016. #SFSuperbowl

entries.title: Congrats to the Sfgiants and Jeremy Affeldt for keeping the world-champion piece...
entries.content:
Congrats to the Sfgiants and Jeremy Affeldt for keeping the world-champion pieces in place. Let's get another one in 2013.


Jeremy Affeldt to re-sign with Giants
www.sfgate.com
Affeldt is expected to undergo a physical Tuesday in San Francisco, another person with knowledge of the situation said, and that is typically the final step in completing a contract. Affeldt, 33, went 1-2 with a 2.70 ERA in 67 appearances covering 63 1/3 innings this season for the World Series ch...

Rave reviews for inaugural film festival : St. Helena Star
napavalleyregister.com
Wylene Wilson of Arizona stood on the Native Sons Hall stage in St. Helena last Sunday absorbing her standing ovation, bowing her head, crying with joy. Most of the audience was crying, too, after seeing the film “Wild Horse, Wild Ride,” documenting her efforts to tame a wild mustang. It was just on...

entries.title: Congrats to the SF Giants! Great to have another World Series in the Bay Area. H...
entries.content:
Congrats to the SF Giants! Great to have another World Series in the Bay Area. Help us bring Super Bowl 50 here too! #SFSuperbowl


All the way back: Giants in World Series
www.sfgate.com
Down three games to one in the National League Championship Series, they dominated the Cardinals over the final three games and bulldozed them 9-0 in the seventh game Monday night. Matt Cain, who had not had a great postseason, blanked the Cardinals for 5 2/3 innings and rode a five-run third innin...

Why do you think the Bowl should come to the Bay? #sfsuperbowl

http://www.sfgate.com/opinion/editorials/article/S-F-would-be-perfect-Super-Bowl-host-3958136.php


S.F. would be perfect Super Bowl host
www.sfgate.com
There could be no more dramatic way of accentuating the Super Bowl's imprint on American culture than to bring the week of festivities to a world-class destination city, and then to stage the game itself in what will be the league's newest and most technologically advanced stadium. A league that ca...
